title: lovesmayfamilis
author: lovesmayfamilis
created_time: April 09, 2023, 01:50:14 PMLast edit: April 10, 2023, 03:04:52 AM by lovesmayfamilis
content: Quote from: 	YOSHIE on October 09, 2022, 02:27:05 PMI'm sick of seeing members who seem to know nothing in this forum, instead of wanting to make a good contribution, actually want to trick other members of this forum, to sympathize.Stop fooling the other members in this forum.MaxreAfter an account under the nickname fennic commits plagiarism, and the moderators do not react to it in any way, after receiving a negative tag, he connects a second account under the nickname classicman1. With whom he successfully exchanges merits.@YOSHIE's investigation that these two accounts are alternate.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5415701.msg61049983#msg61049983Then there is another discovery by @YOSHIE where he shows that in addition to these two accounts, there are two more previously blocked accounts.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5415850.msg61090146#msg61090146@Nutildah now finds a post using an AI tool, and after verifying the Maxre account, you can see that it belongs to the old owner again. And also confirms his other accounts.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5448045.msg62060049#msg62060049Obviously, this account has been bought. https://bpip.org/Profile?p=MaxreBut the owner is so stupid that he does not stop using his old social networks. Quote from: Maxre on April 05, 2023, 11:25:22 AMUsername: MaxreTwitter Link: https://twitter.com/boxofficemoj?t=DnHbs_iSdVxYaYHGn9fzPg&s=09BTC SegWit Address: bc1qz6g4h3dk8xksdexfax4tzux5jc8m423hn5y7xhhttps://archive.fo/Ipc9gQuote from: classickitana on August 25, 2022, 01:35:37 PMBitcoin talk Username: classickitanaTwitter Username: boxofficemojTwitter Profile link: https://twitter.com/boxofficemoj?t=ilVICqoanijsJxXnEzjkIQ&s=09Twitter Followers: 7148BTC adress: 1C7dznmgF2W4EH8SjTXgLL7pF1STnXmud7Facebook Username: Alisha KhanamFacebook profile link: https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100048662956932BTC Address: 1C7dznmgF2W4EH8SjTXgLL7pF1STnXmud7https://loyce.club/archive/posts/6082/60820043.htmlQuote from: Maxre on March 05, 2023, 03:38:28 PMBitcointalk Username: MaxreBitcointalk Link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=1059821 Bitcointalk Rank: Full MemberCurrent Post Count: 872BSC - BEP20 Wallet Adress: 0x6924d6086cEb27Df4256d07b672D289a537bAe05https://archive.fo/qneS7https://ninjastic.space/post/59412237https://ninjastic.space/post/58234124https://ninjastic.space/addresses?address=0x6924d6086cEb27Df4256d07b672D289a537bAe05In addition, many of his posts are the most common shitposting.@YOSHIE, you were right. Stop deceiving people. I will leave him a negative tag.As well as a request to ban this account.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5094661.msg62056782#msg62056782

comments.author: nutildah
comments.body: Great find... But I just have one question: are you saying you think Maxre sold his account and then reclaimed it, taking it back from the person he sold it to? That would be particularly devious, lol.I also connected classickitana to Bila0 and a few other accounts, further evidence of ban evasion:Quote from: nutildah on March 28, 2023, 01:18:05 PMBan evasion #1: classickitanaQuote from: classickitana on September 30, 2022, 10:57:53 AM# Proof Of authentication:-Email: mb160440@gmail.comErc20 adress: 0x20A59dB48Ee8F9B74CD0ad6726b0502090F8Ad89Telegram Username: takeda891Compaigns joined: Registration, Twitter, discord ...Bila0 (banned):Quote from: Bila0 on May 28, 2021, 04:55:01 PMProof of authentication- ETH:0x20A59dB48Ee8F9B74CD0ad6726b0502090F8Ad89- Email: mb160440@gmail.comRef: https://stobox.exchange/auth?ref=28146- Campaigns applied for: Twitter, Facebook, Telegram, Content Creation...

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: No, I think he sold it in 2023. Or at the end of 2022.I've sent a lot of reports to fennic's posts. His writing style is very similar to Maxre's latest posts.

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: Maxre on April 09, 2023, 05:31:00 PMI can't believe there are such Stupid people who are always finding people to block their profiles. What will you get in your whole life?You will be a shitbag for your whole life. Oh, the classical meltdown of the one caught red-handed.I said it a hundred times, don't start topics bragging about stuff when you know you have a ton of skeletons in the closet, I've seen tens of accounts cursing the day they opened a topic about leveling to the hero or senior member only to get a tag for multiple accounts, bought account or other stuff.You couldn't resist bragging about a phone!Quote from: Maxre on April 09, 2023, 05:31:00 PM I am not telling because if they are Earning than let's earn them. Honor Among Thieves! Shitposting farmer version!Btw, @lovesmayfamilis, why didn't you add his name in the title? Might be easier to find by all those that congratulated him on his "achievements".

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.created_time: April 09, 2023, 07:18:29 PMLast edit: April 09, 2023, 07:44:33 PM by YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: lovesmayfamilis on April 09, 2023, 02:17:32 PMNo, I think he sold it in 2023. Or at the end of 2022.I've sent a lot of reports to fennic's posts. His writing style is very similar to Maxre's latest posts.If you pay attention there is something interesting about the @Maxre account.First: @rhomelmabini, has linked @Maxre with @inanilujimi, they both connected both.Proof they are connected: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2544574.msg55237309#msg55237309Second: @Maxre, originally he made a post in the Indonesian local rubric and currently in the Turkish rubric, meaning: @ficihch, ever claimed @Maxre's account was hacked, several members in the discussion told @ficihch, signed the Btc address he used, but he can't, somehow @Maxre account has been recovered.Proof of account being hacked: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5420938.msg61291922#msg61291922QuoteUnfortunately I have never signed messages in the past for bitcoin addresses.  Profile Link ; https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=1059821Third: if you look again at the BTC address used by the @Maxre account, it is also used by the account named: @irsada, he is working in the Rollbit campaign.Proof they are connected.1. Maxre2. irsadaQuote from: Maxre on July 26, 2018, 05:16:14 AMBtctalk name : MaxreRank : Full MemberCurrent post count : 501BTC address 15RpAVXVJorcVbokqDD5s1xN4iDYeibyEZWear appropriate signature : yesWear avatar : yeshttps://archive.vn/wip/uE0hVQuote from: irsada on November 29, 2017, 02:06:04 PMTWITTERBitcointalk username: irsadaTwitter post:https:https://twitter.com/hdactech/status/935690711097163776Twitter account:https://twitter.com/irsada23Twitter followers:392Telegram username:@irsadagustiarBitcoin address:15RpAVXVJorcVbokqDD5s1xN4iDYeibyEZFACEBOOKBitcointalk username:irsadaFacebook post:Facebook account:https://www.facebook.com/irsad.agustiarFacebook friends/followers:1567Telegram username:@irsadagustiarBitcoin address:15RpAVXVJorcVbokqDD5s1xN4iDYeibyEZhttps://archive.vn/wip/bAm05strangely @irsada and @Maxre, made posts in four different locations.@irsada: arabic, spanish, indonesian@Maxre: Türkiye and indonesia.Link: https://archive.vn/wip/Z3dppLink: https://archive.vn/wip/NcMJDConclusion: from some of their evidence above, I strongly suspect that the linked account was sold/purchased or hacked.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: lovesmayfamilis on April 09, 2023, 01:50:14 PMAfter an account under the nickname fennic commits plagiarism, and the moderators do not react to it in any way, after receiving a negative tag, he connects a second account under the nickname classicman1. With whom he successfully exchanges merits.~snip~I honestly thought that after so much evidence @fennic got a perma-ban and that I wouldn't hear about him again on the forum, but he seems to have nine lives or one of the admins is his uncle It's clear to me that you can't just kick some people out of the forum because they keep coming back like a boomerang, but don't evil fees play any role for those people? Do they pay for new accounts, or do they somehow slip through the system?

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: I saw an account that's also suspicious of being owned by the same person running Fennic, Maxre, and the rest connected accounts.I don't have enough proof but you could take a look at the account.1. Merit cycle:KFC786If you take a look at the merit history of this account you'll that only fennic sent merit to the account while both maxre and Fennic were the only ones who received merits from the account.although the posts[1][2] have been deleted you can still view them here. [1] https://ninjastic.space/post/61478030[2] https://ninjastic.space/post/614795132. Posting style:If you take a good look at Maxre, Fennic, and KFC786 posting styles you'll notice that they all make the same type of list and also have similar spelling errors.Quote from: Maxre on April 09, 2023, 05:33:19 AMThere are a lot of things that we have to keep in mind and these are listed below 👇👇👇1. Work Hard: this is a key to success. Always work hard and this will lead you to successQuote from: KFC786 on January 17, 2023, 02:15:33 AMThere a re a lot of reasons behind Bitcoin pump and also dump and some of these are described as below,1. Bitcoin Large institutions also control a lot of Bitcoin fluctuations. Quote from: fennic on January 04, 2023, 03:37:24 PMMy wishes are very simple in coming day and these are just described below 👇1. I have at least 1 Bitcoin in coming yearsDuring my investigation, I noticed something. I know that Gmail sometimes suggests names for us by adding some strings of numbers to our preferred name, but I don't think it's a coincidence that an account connected to Fennis and another connected account have the same number in their Gmail username.Quote from: Bila0 on May 28, 2021, 04:55:01 PM~~~- Email: mb160440@gmail.com~~~Quote from: Lucius on April 10, 2023, 10:23:20 AM~~~but don't evil fees play any role for those people? Do they pay for new accounts, or do they somehow slip through the system?With VPN one could easily avoid paying the evil fees by changing their IP address, so unless theymos figures out a way, to stop the creation of an account with a VPN evil fee is not going to do anything.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: And all this could have been avoided if Maxre didn't start that bullshit merit fishing topic about buying his first mobile phone using signature campaign earnings that caught attention initially, then to go on with use of chatbot. Once again forum shitposter has been flying too high to the sun just to get rekted, like Icarus did.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: YOSHIE on April 09, 2023, 07:18:29 PMSecond: @Maxre, originally he made a post in the Indonesian local rubric and currently in the Turkish rubric, meaning: @ficihch, ever claimed @Maxre's account was hacked, several members in the discussion told @ficihch, signed the Btc address he used, but he can't, somehow @Maxre account has been recovered.Proof of account being hacked: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5420938.msg61291922#msg61291922He successfully signed the address and his account was unblocked, follow that thread to the end.And on the Turkish board he has no purpose whatsoever other than simply requesting post review for merit, but I doubt his accent. Just tried to G-translating the sentence, there is a word that can't be translated, even I'm sure it's not a Turkish word as far as no other Turkish member has ever written on that board.Quote from: Maxre on March 08, 2023, 07:37:00 AMSıralama zamanı, teşekkürler qho beni destekle

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: stompix on April 09, 2023, 06:09:29 PMQuote from: Maxre on April 09, 2023, 05:31:00 PMI can't believe there are such Stupid people who are always finding people to block their profiles. What will you get in your whole life?You will be a shitbag for your whole life. Oh, the classical meltdown of the one caught red-handed.I said it a hundred times, don't start topics bragging about stuff when you know you have a ton of skeletons in the closetSeriously; people think they're only going to get some kind of kudos or other positive response (and they just may from some members), but you know there are going to be one or two people who start to do a little bit of digging and find out that congratulations & praise are the last thing the person deserves.  I've seen it many times myself....and yet it never ceases to make me chuckle inside.Maxre, stop blaming other people for what you did wrong.  That advice will serve you well not only on bitcointalk but in life.  Just sayin', now.

comments.author: Orpichukwu
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on April 10, 2023, 10:23:20 AM but don't evil fees play any role for those people? Do they pay for new accounts, or do they somehow slip through the system?Yes those exposed ones have found a way to slip through the system. With a very strong VPN you can change your device IP and location which the system won't be able to detect again. And they will create a successful new account over again and start with their spamming. If it cost them money to pay for those evil, they could have stopped long ago.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: Quote from: Orpichukwu on April 17, 2023, 02:05:23 PMQuote from: Lucius on April 10, 2023, 10:23:20 AM but don't evil fees play any role for those people? Do they pay for new accounts, or do they somehow slip through the system?Yes those exposed ones have found a way to slip through the system. With a very strong VPN you can change your device IP and location which the system won't be able to detect again. And they will create a successful new account over again and start with their spamming. If it cost them money to pay for those evil, they could have stopped long ago. Not only that, there are countries where there are also some internet providers which offer their clients dynamic IP addresses. That is my case, for some reason my internet provider does not offer fixed addresses, as a consequence I have noticed that my login history in this forum varies widely among locations around the country.  Because of that it has happened to me that years ago I wanted to participate in a different webpage and I realized the IP was banned, even though that was the first time I enter there.  In those instances ban evasion is even easier, there is no need for a VPN.
